name: Tartaletas dulces
description: /'Sweet tartlets'/ Bite-sized pastries, filled with a variety of ingredients and open on top. Though first seen in older times, sweet tartlets came to popularity with the spread of sugar in medieval Europe

Base: 100g butter (salted may be ok, though I would go with unsalted and adding a pinch of salt instead)

instructions: - Mix flour, sugar and cold butter until well combined. Now add egg, vanilla and knead until well mixed. Put it in the fridge 1h.
- Using a rolling pin and sprinkling some flour if needed, extend the dough well, aiming for a 0.5-1mm thickness
- Meanwhile cut the dough sheet in portions and press them inside each mould. You can use the edge of a glass to press and cut evenly sized portions.
Dulce de leche: Submerge a condensed milk can under water in a pot. Boil for 3h to get caramel-like color.
Special creams and custards: lemon curd, creme patisserie, crema diplomatica, stabilized whipped cream...
Shavings or dusting on top, from i.e. chocolate, cacao, cocoa, cinnamon
or a combination of any of the above.
If you plan on filling with jams, a good option is to make thin dough stripes to form a lattice pattern on top

culinary: When piping the filling, you can decorate as much as you want, but beware if it's not thick enough it will slowly lose shape.
Very humid fillings like cream may make the tartlet soggy on the bottom. Glazing it with jam first helps it remain dry.
